e4: Given the current legal and ethical concerns, as well as considering fairness to all investors within different groups, it is highly recommended that ABC changes the policy to new reporting without bias. Trans parent reporting sets a favorable business standard of honesty and helps establish investor trust over time while mitigating unnecessary risks posed by inaccurate reporting. Although there might be some short-term volatility in stock performance, adhering to integrity in financial communication benefits the long-term health of the company.
e5: Characteristics of an ethical reporting policy includes honesty, transparency, credibility, fairness, and adherence to industry standards and regulations. An ethically sound reporting policy should accurately reflect a company's financial performance to all investors equally without any biases or misrepresentations, establishing trust in the marketplace. This enhances integrity and builds long-term reputation while leveling the playing field for various investor groups from sophisticated hedge funds to small retail investors. Moreover, an ethically sound policy considers legal implications, maintaining compliance with regulatory bodies such as the SEC.
e6: In this ethical assessment, consider the legal responsibilities of corporate officers, conflicts in current & potential policy adoption for ABC due to market manipulation and hedge-fund advantages. Furthermore, focus on fairness towards retail investors when adjusting accounting practices by clarifying transparency around investor relations communication to the stakeholders and addressing short/long-term market ramifications
